snippet: Lawmakers on the local level who support a higher minimum wage show Congress where it needs to go.
abstract: Editorial applauds Seattle's approval of $15-an-hour minimum wage; contends that wage, nation's highest minimum, changes terms of minimum wage debate and expands realm of possibilities in setting new minimums; holds that questions remain as to whether such actions by other cities and states will prompt Congress to follow suit.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers on the local level who support a higher minimum wage show Congress where it needs to go.
